column4: not really. There isn't much that will magically make 73GB of data synchronize incredibly quickly. Even a straight copy would take a noticeable time. Depending on how out of sync they are, a straight copy might even be faster...
The 73GB file already is copied straight over. Is keeping these two in sync am interesting of.
I don't know of a faster method. If it were made up of a bunch of smaller files, you could do it much more quickly by comparing modification times on the individual files I suppose...
